solution.text:
Let the angles be _{j}_x, _{k}_x, _{l}_x, _{{20-j-k-l}}_x.
The sum of all the angles of a quadrilateral is \(360^o\)
Hence, \(_{j}_x + _{k}_x + _{l}_x + _{{20-j-k-l}}_x =360\)
\(20x=360\)
\(x=18\)
Therefore, the smallest angle is \(_{{min(j,k,l)}}_ \times 18 = _{{min(j,k,l)*18}}_\)

content.text: The four angles of a quadrilateral are in the ratio _{j}_ : _{k}_ : _{l}_ : _{{20-j-k-l}}_. Find the smallest angle
